data.title: Fix crash when using cocos2d::Controller on iOS6
data.body:
Using Controller on iOS6 crashes the app because GameController.framework was only added on iOS7. 

This PR fixes that crash by doing nothing in Controller::startDiscoveryController if the class GCController is not available.

data.title: AudioThreadPool race condition on Windows.
data.body:
_Version_
- v3.8

_Description_
- On Win32, the threads from the AudioThreadPool are created detached, this causes a possible race condition where the AudioEngineThreadPool can be destroyed and threadFunc() tries to lock _queueMutex. Since the object has been destroyed, threadFunc then crashes because it tries to access a non-existent object.

_Question_
Is there a reason to create them detached on Win32? Unless it is absolutely necessary, they should join so the race condition disappears.

data.title: SIGABRT signal on iOS 6 when using the `AssetsManagerEx` class
data.body:
I was tasted this on several devices (iPhone4, iPhone5s, iPhone6, iPad Air) but only iPhone4 with iOS 6.1 is catches the error, all other devices had > iOS v7 and didn't have `SIGABRT` signal. So, the problem is in `CCDownloader-apple.mm:257`:

``` c
    if (resumeData)
    {
        ocTask = [self.downloadSession downloadTaskWithResumeData:resumeData];
    }
    else
    {
        ocTask = [self.downloadSession downloadTaskWithRequest:request];
    }
    [self.taskDict setObject:[[DownloadTaskWrapper alloc] init:task] forKey:ocTask]; // <-- the problem is here, ocTask is nil
    [ocTask resume];
```

The output:

```
cocos2d: surface size: 960x640

{
    cocos2d.x.version: cocos2d-x-3.9
    cocos2d.x.compiled_with_gl_state_cache: true
    cocos2d.x.build_type: DEBUG
    gl.supports_vertex_array_object: true
    cocos2d.x.compiled_with_profiler: false
    gl.renderer: PowerVR SGX 535
    gl.vendor: Imagination Technologies
    gl.max_texture_size: 2048
    gl.max_samples_allowed: 4
    gl.version: OpenGL ES 2.0 IMGSGX535-73.16.1
    gl.supports_S3TC: false
    gl.supports_ATITC: false
    gl.supports_ETC1: false
    gl.max_texture_units: 8
    gl.supports_PVRTC: true
    gl.supports_NPOT: true
    gl.supports_discard_framebuffer: true
    gl.supports_BGRA8888: false
}

*** Terminating app due to uncaught exception 'NSInvalidArgumentException', reason: '*** setObjectForKey: key cannot be nil'
*** First throw call stack:
(0x31ef12a3 0x39b9697f 0x31e53313 0xf2bd3 0xf1b13 0x254f15 0x21a4b5 0x21c9eb 0x7f449 0x9b2b9 0x7cc05 0x33d59ad9 0x33d59663 0x33d5184b 0x33cf9c39 0x33cf96cd 0x33cf911b 0x359fc5a3 0x359fc1d3 0x31ec6173 0x31ec6117 0x31ec4f99 0x31e37ebd 0x31e37d49 0x33d50485 0x33d4d301 0x80737 0x39fcdb20)
libc++abi.dylib: terminate called throwing an exception
```

If you would like to get an error, let's try standard using of `AssetsManagerEx` class:

``` c
auto am = AssetsManagerEx::create(manifestUrl, destPath);
am->retain();
auto listener = EventListenerAssetsManagerEx::create(am, [&](EventAssetsManagerEx* event){...});
Director::getInstance()->getEventDispatcher()->addEventListenerWithFixedPriority(listener, 1);
am->update(); // here is the problem
```

data.title: Crash on Android when reopen Cocos2dxActivity
data.body:
I'm using cocos2dx for single game activity inside Android app.
When activity is created, it starts director with single scene.
When activity is about to close, it ends director.
When terminateProcessJNI() is called by android GLView implementation, I finish activity instead of shutting down the whole android process.
But when I start that game activity again, it crashes.
I'm using logcat + ndk-stack and it shows SIGSEGV in CCFrameBuffer.cpp, FrameBuffer::applyFBO() method.

Using latest version of cocos2dx, build with ndk-build.

data.title: Fix onEndEditing issue in script.
data.body: Issue: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/14332

data.title: Combine Studio change for particle 3d
Combine Studio change for UI components
data.body:
This PR can not pass auto build, because it need 2d/CocosStudioExtension.h file in 2d component combine pr.

This is a big PR. But most modify is to save resource file name, and add function that can return these resource file name back. And some other function modify is to clean / replace resource already loaded. Because in editor, resource may change often, not like in game, after resource loaded, it never change.

UILayoutComponent.cpp is changed for make sub component do the right layout operation by Liam.

data.title: about spidermonkey's source code
data.body:
For some reason, we need spidermonkey's source code which version in cocos2d-x.
When we search at repo 'cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-src', but not found. And download at  [Ricardo Quesada's Spidermonkey fork](https://github.com/ricardoquesada/Spidermonkey), found so much different from cocos2d-x release.
![qq 20151118114924](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3910887/11232133/9d40d59c-8dea-11e5-9647-99834193c36f.png)
so, could you please tell me where can get spidermonkey's source code which version in cocos2d-x ?
thanks.

data.title: android上游戏从后台切换回到前台或者从第三方应用切回来,ttf字体有时候出现纹理丢失
data.body:
引擎版本：3.7
使用ui组件：UIText
ccs：1.6

android上游戏从后台切换回到前台或者从第三方应用切回来,ttf字体有时候出现纹理丢失导致部分字体无法显示，非必现，但出现概率还是挺高，求解决方案，魅族4，三星s6都出现这样问题，概率高, 原生系统也会出现

data.title: Fix edit box native size and a typo on placeholder font
data.body:
The EditBox native parts need to be set after nodeToWorldTransform, for when parents have scale != 1. Tested on various iOS simulators, I don't have easy access to other platforms.

There was also a typo in setPlaceholderFontName which would result in placeholder incorrectly using normal label font size.

data.title: UIEditBox not aligned when the text been selected.
data.body:
As the follow picture shows, before select (left), it works fine.
Then I select the text, the  "select cut copy paste" toolbar shows, and it pushed the UIEditBox down (right).

![uieditbox](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20248/11183525/2b5f7b7e-8cad-11e5-81fa-4200185dad3e.png)

I have tested under Android 5.1.1 (Mi note with original Android 5.1.1 ROM.)

data.body: Should compare `cc.loader.loadImg` implementation between these two version and test.

data.title: [WEB] iOS UIWebView (WeChat) back from background will crash app
data.body:
1. In Wechat, open a page with Cocos2d-JS webgl render mode
2. share during game process
3. crash can be reproduced frequently while returning back to game from sharing view

Tencent provided a crash log

![wechat_1447661792](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/632460/11178526/5bfe4f78-8c88-11e5-880b-bfe7e1764022.png)

Basically, it can be reproduced in any app with UIWebView and a webgl page.

To fix this issue, we'd better find out a walk around to avoid the issue, the original issue in UIWebView can't be fixed in the web engine
